ygData.subject: Re: Crowded Zones
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with you about the lagginess of unrest.  I think it s mainly due to the fact that its such a small zone.  Theres always lots of movement there,
ygData.messageBody:
I agree with you about the lagginess of unrest. I think it's mainly
due to the fact that its such a small zone. Theres always lots of
movement there, especially during a fresh spawn. And, as far as I'm
concerned, 55 is too many for a zone of that size. One thing that has
helped me with my lag is turning off any video effects. I believe it's
particle effects but I'm not sure (at work). It helps with video lag
tremendously. The only downside (if you consider it a downside) is
that you cant see the "fireworks" that come with the spells and you
cant see rain or snow. It doesnt affect the game play and I really
dont miss out on it =)

Another thing that tends to slow me down is my sound card. It's an
onboard and it sucks. I keep my 3d sound off and go about my business.
It's not bad, just not as many sound effects.

Hope this helped some!

--- Azor <jmaynus@...> wrote:
> From: "Azor" <jmaynus@...>
>
> Last night (or this morning, depends on how you look
> at 12am), I was in
> Unrest was a group of 5 for a while. I did a /
> which will tell ya who's in
> the zone and it said there were only 55 people in
> Unrest. Yes 55 people but
> still laggy as crap in there. I got attacked by a
> Werebat and some kinda
> skel maybe a monk can't remember but I could not see
> them at all, thats
> happened to me in Steamfont with Minos. It'll say
> you are hit by a Mino for
> whatever but you can't see them. But anyways I take
> off from the Werebat
> and Skel just to be killed by a Hag. But running
> even with SoW on ya in
> Unrest can be a pain cause of the lag. At times it
> wasn't bad at all but
> other times WOW lag slowed ya down a lot.
> Also looted a corpse someone left in Unrest to find
> a Small Bronze Collar.
> Heard it was worth maybe 10-12pp but sell it to a
> store and they only wanna
> give ya 8gp, yeah right like I'd take 8gp for a
> Bronze Collar.
>
> **************************
> Azor
> Lvl 16 Human Cleric of the Rathe
> **************************
>
> > From: jdean2@...
> >
> > I know, I know, Rodcet Nife isn't as crowded as
> > many of the other servers, but it can still be
> > crowded. I suggest searching for new areas. I
> > have found a zone that has never had more than 25
> > people in it since I have been there. Exp. is
> > great and I am making about 60pp a day in loot.
> > Did I mention that I now have full bronze from
> > this same zone? I am not a level 49 player
> > either. I made 18 last night and I already have
> > two bubbles of exp. toward 19. I have all the lvl
> > 19 spells bought, an incredible amount of jewelry,
> > and over 500pp in the bank. Once again I implore
> > you to travel and to form 6 member groups. If you
> > hear about a great place then every one else has
> > also. Find your own area. There are many that
> > are hardly ever visited and you'll have your
> > cloice on what, when, and where to kill.
> >
> > Blessed
> > Level 18 Cleric
> > Rodcet Nife
